00001 /*===========================================================================
00002 =                                                                           =
00003 =                            MtkCreateGeoGrid                               =
00004 =                                                                           =
00005 =============================================================================

00007                          Jet Propulsion Laboratory

00011             Copyright 2005, California Institute of Technology.
00012                            ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

00015 ============================================================================*/
00016 
00017 #include "MisrReProject.h"
00018 #include "MisrError.h"
00019 #include "MisrUtil.h"
00020 
00036 MTKt_status MtkCreateGeoGrid(
00037   double ulc_lat_dd,       
00038   double ulc_lon_dd,       
00039   double lrc_lat_dd,       
00040   double lrc_lon_dd,       
00041   double lat_cellsize_dd,  
00042   double lon_cellsize_dd,  
00043   MTKt_DataBuffer *latbuf, 
00044   MTKt_DataBuffer *lonbuf   )
00045 {
00046   MTKt_status status;           /* Return status */
00047   MTKt_status status_code;      /* Return code of this function */
00048   MTKt_DataBuffer lat = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT;
00049                                 /* Latitude data buffer structure */
00050   MTKt_DataBuffer lon = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT;
00051                                 /* Longitude data buffer structure */
00052   double lat_extent_dd;         /* Latitude extent */
00053   double lon_extent_dd;         /* Longitude extent */
00054   double lontmp;        /* Temporary longitude */
00055   int nline;            /* Number of lines */
00056   int nsample;          /* Number of samples */
00057   int l;            /* Line index */
00058   int s;            /* Sample index */
00059 
00060   /* Check latitude bounds */
00061   if (ulc_lat_dd > 90.0 || ulc_lat_dd < -90.0)
00062     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00063   if (lrc_lat_dd > 90.0 || lrc_lat_dd < -90.0)
00064     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00065   if (ulc_lat_dd < lrc_lat_dd)
00066     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00067 
00068   /* Check longitude bounds */
00069   if (ulc_lon_dd > 180.0 || ulc_lon_dd < -180.0)
00070     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00071   if (lrc_lon_dd > 180.0 || lrc_lon_dd < -180.0)
00072     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00073 
00074   /* Check latitude cell size bounds */
00075   if (lat_cellsize_dd <= 0.0)
00076     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00077 
00078   /* Check longitude cell size bounds */
00079   if (lon_cellsize_dd <= 0.0)
00080     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00081 
00082   /* Check for date line crossing */
00083   lat_extent_dd = ulc_lat_dd - lrc_lat_dd;
00084   if (ulc_lon_dd > lrc_lon_dd) {
00085     lon_extent_dd = 360 + lrc_lon_dd - ulc_lon_dd;      /* Date line crossed */
00086   } else {
00087     lon_extent_dd = lrc_lon_dd - ulc_lon_dd;
00088   }
00089 
00090   nline = lat_extent_dd / lat_cellsize_dd + 1;
00091   nsample = lon_extent_dd / lon_cellsize_dd + 1;
00092 
00093   /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00094   /* Allocate buffers of the latitude and longitude data */
00095   /* --------------------------------------------------- */
00096 
00097   status = MtkDataBufferAllocate(nline, nsample, MTKe_double, &lat);
00098   MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00099   status = MtkDataBufferAllocate(nline, nsample, MTKe_double, &lon);
00100   MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00101 
00102   /* ------------------------ */
00103   /* Compute Geographic Grid  */
00104   /* ------------------------ */
00105 
00106   if (ulc_lon_dd > lrc_lon_dd) {
00107     for (l=0; l < nline; l++) {                         /* Date line crossed */
00108       for (s=0; s < nsample; s++) {
00109     lat.data.d[l][s] = ulc_lat_dd - lat_cellsize_dd * l;
00110     lontmp =  ulc_lon_dd + lon_cellsize_dd * s;
00111     lon.data.d[l][s] = lontmp > 180 ? lontmp - 360.0 : lontmp;
00112       }
00113     }
00114   } else {
00115     for (l=0; l < nline; l++) {
00116       for (s=0; s < nsample; s++) {
00117     lat.data.d[l][s] = ulc_lat_dd - lat_cellsize_dd * l;
00118     lon.data.d[l][s] = ulc_lon_dd + lon_cellsize_dd * s;
00119       }
00120     }
00121   }
00122 
00123   *latbuf = lat;
00124   *lonbuf = lon;
00125 
00126   return MTK_SUCCESS;
00127 ERROR_HANDLE:
00128   MtkDataBufferFree(&lat);
00129   MtkDataBufferFree(&lon);
00130   return status_code;
00131 }
